sentences: Matt Molloy (born 12 January 1947) is an Irish musician, from a region known for producing talented flautists.
During the 1970s, Molloy was a member of The Bothy Band and its successor, the re-founded Planxty.
He joined The Chieftains in 1979, replacing Michael Tubridy.
Molloy owns a pub on Bridge Street in Westport, County Mayo where there are regular Irish music sessions.
Solo AlbumsMatt Molloy with Donal Lunny (1976)
The West Ocean String Quartet (with Matt Molloy):The Guiding Moon (2007)
Pathway to the Well (2007) Matt Molloy, John Carty, Arty McGlynn
